job_title: Online Data Entry in Mystic, CT
pros: Love working there, hope to be there still in 2022
cons: Wish they would give raises

review_title: This place will treat you like a ANIMAL
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Mystic, CT
pros: Spending time with the residents. Other than that..good luck. You will never get raises, you will be given double your work load as time goes on and you will always be short because no one wants to work there.
cons: They never offer bonuses when they are short beyond $50 (and most times that is on a gift card) they work you to the BONE and give you little to no credit for all the hard work you are doing. They have HORRIBLE leaders and most of the nurses sit on their butts or hide instead of caring for the residents. I can’t tell you how many times I left this place in tears because of the work I was expected to complete within a eight hour period. Oh! And don’t you DARE tell management how you are feeling or they will circle in on you and find different reasons to tell you what a piece of garbage you are. It’s not worth it ladies look elsewhere!!!

job_title: Wait Staff/Bartender in New Haven, CT
pros: Convenient for high schooler schedule
cons: Bad pay, bad hours, rude management

review_title: This is a horrible place to work!!
pros: There are no pros to this place besides the actual residents. They treat their employees like animals. They treat you as though you are replaceable and only a number. For nursing week we got NOTHING, for working through Covid we got NOTHING. They want to change the rules every other week instead of focusing on what is going wrong in their company. Masonicare at Mystic is tan by a bunch of heartless, control freaks who are all trying to control the ship.
cons:
False promises.
We had a 3% raise this year (pennies)
They add more and more responsibilities as they feel like it
The management such as Human Resources are a bunch of liars. She will lie right to your face and won’t blink a eye when you tell her of your needs.
They forget that there are MANY other places looking for help, paying a much better wage and treating their employees right 
They mess your paycheck up every other week because they can’t keep anyone around long enough to do them continuously
Everyone is leaving, no ONE wants to work here
The work moral is AWEFUL all everyone talks about is quiting or looking for another job
They pick favorites and come down on others with write ups 
They do not play by their own corporate rules and they LOVE making you their slave. 
Work your wage ladies and don’t go above and beyond for this DISGUSTING company.

job_title: Home Care Physical Therapist in Wallingford, CT
pros:
-Direct clinical colleagues And the nurses we worked alongside were awesome to work with. We always had each other’s backs. 
-at the time under Masonicare prior to outsourcing our supervisors were also wonderful.
-pay WAS good But we also took steep cut in pay with the new outsourced company
cons:
This company used to be phenomenal to work for. Upper management/CEO turned its back on its entire Rehab staff (all PTs, OTs and SLPs) in an 11th hour meeting where we were all fired and a few hours later had to Interview for our jobs with the new outsource company HealthPro Heritage (which by the way is also a horrible company so stay away from them as well). Staff lost all of its seniority and got paid PTO at a very reduced rate. It’s also important to note that the CEO, JP Venoit didn’t even show up at this meeting where we were all fired. This in itself demonstrates the poor integrity of the company.
-since outsourcing Rehab Staff to HealthPro Heritage 75% of the original staff have left the companies and staff that HealthPro hired have come and left. They have a very hard time keeping any staff
-turns its back on its employees
-Pay cuts
-takes away all seniority
-Poor management
-severe reduced pay out of PTO
-Took away a 24 hour position in the Outsourcing leaving many staff with no alternative for a job with the new company.

review_title: Save yourself and find a better opportunity!
pros: Nobody knows how to manage so I guess that provides some flexibility and autonomy? Don't expect to be rewarded or compensated though for doing a good job.
cons: Terrible and toxic work environment. Went through nightmare experience after nightmare experience regarding terrible management and high turnover with both management and staff. People at the top are dishonest and have zero integrity. Bullying and microagression is well tolerated even with it being reported. Many narcissistic personalities and egos to contend with. Many hardworking employees have not received raises in years. So much bad behavior is swept under the rug. Please save yourself and find another job! It's not worth it. The service lines are a mess and their pay is very disappointing. If they dare give you what you ask for expect to sell your soul for that salary. And they'll only cough up because they are desperate. Overworked and underpaid is the culture.

job_title: Home Health Nurse in Waterbury, CT
pros: good pay, benefits, and team oriented.
cons: understaffed and overworked at times

review_title: Great for side income or 1st job during high school/college
job_title: Food Service Worker in Wallingford, CT
pros: The pros include a flexible work schedule. They alos include offerings on finacial literacy, helping with mental health, and can get scholarships/ programs to help you further your college career in general or more specifically with hands on training in the health care industry.
cons: Would have to work on holidays and in inclement weather becuase this is an essential business where people are needed to work each day.

pros: Masonicare has a generous tuition reimbursement that enables its employees to move to the next level in their career.
cons: The cons are there is a nursing shortage in general and staffing is a challenge.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wallingford, CT
pros:
I loved my residents and liked most of my co-workers.
Attractive facility (when you aren't in long term care, which is visually depressing).
cons: ALWAYS short staffed. Expected to get a whole floor (60) washed, dressed and into bed after doing supper duties. CNA's responsible for taking meal orders, setting up trays, beverages, serving, feeding, and clearing dishes BEFORE doing any patient care, while also needing to obtain vitals and answer call lights. Impossible expectations = absolute failure and the residents suffer. Unacceptable. When I took the job at Masonic I had higher expectations. Turns out they were just like any other, and in some ways worse.

review_title: It was a job. Nothing more, nothing less
job_title: Home Health Registered Nurse in Wallingford, CT
pros: I enjoyed the ability to work autonomously, and getting paid every week is always a pro. They offer extensive benefits, and the field/office staff are all really nice and easy going. They provide laptop and cell phone with its own Hotspot.
cons: Insurance was expensive with super high deductible plans. No company car. The electronic medical record system used was not live so frequent transfers and syncing was required. Daily meetings and these meetings did not count towards points required for productivity. They did not account for time traveled between residents homes so the work days were extremely long.. They are huge supporters of our current president....creepy, sleepy Joe Bye den. And they won't let you work unless you take the jab!!

job_title: Environmental Service Aide in New Haven, CT
pros: good for a starter job
cons: almost everything about the company

pros: Some of the other employees were nice
cons: The company is top heavy and more concerned about the people receiving their bonuses and outrageous salaries instead of offering healthcare benefits to staff. Most of the nurses there that have children can not afford to have their family om the insurance plan and rely on state insurance for them.

review_title: Don’t do it! Save your soul and your time.
pros: Absolutely nothing. Did I mention nothing? Because absolutely nothing.!
cons:
The place has no stable bosses/DNS etc. 
The insurance is absolutely horrible. You get a 1% raise annually. There is no holiday bonuses at all. Zero incentives to work or pick up overtime. They don’t pay uniform allowances or your license fees. They then will randomly change your assigned unit/floor and your shift and not inform you about the changes. Half of the building is shut down. 
They treat their employees like crap. I wouldn’t recommend my dog to stay there, mind you a relative.

pros: Great place to work. Coworkers really care about the patients/residents. Benefits are not the best, but in today’s atmosphere, it’s not bad.
cons: Leadership is not diverse in our changing world.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wallingford, CT
pros: Close to home. Pay is ok. No more
cons: Too much favor. Nurses. Suck

pros: I loved the care i could give my patients
cons: Management changed and things worsened.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Bristol, CT
pros:
- overtime available
-well paid
-great team members (depending on floor)
cons:
-shortage in staff
-miscommunication of staff/administration

review_title: CEO makes $1M but nursing units understaffed and overworked
pros: None.  I only stay for the patients.  Even then, it's tough not to look elsewhere for work.
cons:
It's time employees start educating themselves because we're not getting paid enough!!  I have a family with 3 kids to support, wages are just not fair.  I encourage you to look up Form 990 Schedule J Part II.  Masonicare is a non-profit and this information is open to the public on the filing.  There is no confidential information here but the big shots don't want us knowing this info.  

I encourage my coworkers to unite.  Don't you like the song and dance they sing when they come around crying how "times are tough" and we need to cut expenses and do more with less??  Have we ever seen a bonus?  Do we make close to a million dollars?  We sure don't and we pour our lives into this place.  Instead of focusing on important things, like how understaffed and stressed we are, they're worried about parking policies.  The priorities of management are so lopsided but what do they care when they take home fat checks?  The biggest thing management fears is an informed and organized workforce because that's when they'll finally be held accountable.

pros: Good benefits and good environment
cons: No cons very happy here

review_title: Company has great potential but cannot seem to get it together
pros: Some great co-workers; Salaries good in certain areas; provide good services to some
cons: No room for growth in most areas; No consistency throughout continuum when it comes to treatment of employees; Management tries to push a culture change that is truly a joke; Have to use your PTO time if there is a bad storm and cannot make it to work even with state roads closed; High school mentality prevails even with management - if you are not part of the "clique", you are not treated as well.  If you have an issue and try to go to HR to find resolution, you may be told "well I guess it might be time for you to find a new job elsewhere".   Have lost some good mid-level clinical management who realize things are not what they could be.

pros: Great coworkers.  Nice campus. Alright pay within the field.  They offer benefits for positions starting at 24hrs a week.  I absolutely love the residents we care for.
cons:
Senior management brought in a 3rd party company to do a employee engagement survey and run focus groups last year.  So far, I haven't seen ANY improvements or attempts to fix any problems. Let alone a plan of action. 
This seems to be a problem at all levels of management.  They become aware of an issue or concern, they "yes" you to death and at the end of the day, nothing was solved.
Favoritism is rampant.  Supervisors will deny it, but it's obvious.
CNAs work extremely short staffed.  90% of the time, we are unable to take our 30 minute lunch break due to resident needs.  Where are our supervisors?  Why aren't they willing to get their hands dirty and help us out?  They act as if they are above it.
CNAs get burned out easily due to staffing shortages and uneven work assignments.  One floor will have 4 incontinence checks per night/per aide while another will have 20.  
Praise and "recognition" from supervisors seem hollow and insincere.
Also, any input given by lower level staff to improve morale or conditions is routinely ignored.

pros: I can’t think of anything
cons: Everything. Give your life to a company and they toss you out like you’re nothing. Don’t bother

review_title: Not Satisfied - See HR? That's a Joke
pros: Until management change it has one of the most respected long term care and rehab facilities in CT, with every kind of service conveniently located on a beautiful accessible campus. HR was available to resolve complaints and conflicts. Patients and staff were caring and had with genuine relationships. The wishes of residents and families were respected. There was a quality of life for residents and staff. I can no longer refer friends and family to Masonicare in good conscience.
cons: Under new management Masonicare has lost it's long standing genuine culture and has been subjected to a make-over with the imposition of a phoney culture, cut backs, positions being eliminated, firing dedicated employees including one who worked there for 49 years. Two employees died last month after being subjected to stressful conditions. Every negative review says see HR which is a joke since they now act as the executioner rather than problem solvers. Notice that positive reviews are written by recruiters who are very young and replacing dedicated workers with young inexperienced applicants who are put in management roles.

pros: Nursing Supervisor, kind,excellent morals and values. Ongoing education, in-servicing frequently.Work-life balance could at times be not so balanced, as assignments change's were frequent according to patient need's. Loved teaching patients and family member's regarding illness/recovery. Hospice and palliative nursing excellent. The training in Wallingford was so much fun and really informative.
cons: Small office, difficult at times to concentrate. Little to much backstabbing at times. However the supervisor had quick control of situation. Unfortunately at times some of the case manager's tended to hand off "the difficult patient's" to the lpn's very frequently. Also there was favortism among the home health aides. Many times the aides would say "well if the scheduler didn't like you for whatever reason you won't get the hours".

review_title: Mediocre and at some points terrible
job_title: Business Support Specialist in Wallingford, CT
pros:
Great Invironment
Allowed to work independently
Lots of room for movement, even if it is slow.
cons:
Undervalued and Opinions are not considered by upper management, even when they hold a special meeting to adress concerns.

Horrible pay I was offered a full time position at 12hr. Turns out my part time coworkers are making 13-16.

Horrible sensitive information keeping. I stumbled across a document that contained pay's and social security numbers.

Terrible mangement of PTO, paid time off, no option to not use it. Everything is lumped into it, i.e Sick time, scheduled and unscheduled time off, personal days. etc 

Since I've been here, I've watched three supervisors get fired and walked out with no cause.

review_title: Staff home care PT job means you'll be working for free--beware!
job_title: Staff Home Care PT in East Lyme, CT
pros: Great company philosophy. Top, top management make a good show of reaching out to people in all types of jobs at the company.
cons: Company philosophy does not trickle down to health care workers on the front lines. As staff PT you will have to meet quota regardless of hours you're actually being paid to work. In a huge driving territory (expect to drive 50-60 min between patients pretty regularly), that means you'll work many hours each week for free between visits, driving and computer paperwork. Look elsewhere if you want to get paid for the time you are actually putting into your job.

pros: I am fairly new to Masonicare about 6 months, and can honestly say that I have found an organization I am happy to be a part of. From the interview process through to my current work load I feel that I have the support and resources needed to succeed. The company is very good at communicating events, on-goings, and announcements. I always feel that the department I work in is kept in the loop, and effectively shares information and resources that are needed. The organization does a lot of great things for the community and offers a lot of activities, events, and information to its employees making it a great place to work for.
cons: At this point in time, I feel that their are not any cons that would sway my opinion of the organization.

review_title: Co-workers are great - Admin, not so much
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Wallingford, CT
pros:
Awesome co-workers!
Great residents and resident families
Pay is good
cons:
Administration only cares about appearance and making themselves look good, will throw anyone else under the bus to do so. 

The company is marketed to be such a great place to work on the outside, but once you’ve worked there for a while you find out how extremely phony that persona is. 

Not even an ounce of appreciation for cna or nursing staff.

Looks down on nursing staff - the feeling of being “beneath” all other departments (recreation, dining, admin, front desk staff, etc) is overwhelming.

review_title: Wonderful organization I feel blessed to be a part of!
pros: The patients come first at Masonciare, bottom line.  As a clinical employee I am proud of the level of care I am able to deliver on a daily basis and proud to work for an organization with such strong community ties as Masonicare.  The organization's reputation speaks for itself.  You will not find another company with as many long term staff  - in many cases 20 years+!
cons: Their IT department is slow to respond sometimes.

review_title: Still the old boys club in upper management.
pros: The caregiving staff is amazing to work with and the quality of care given is some of the best in the state.
cons: Upper management made up of mostly Masonic fraternity affiliated males.  Don't expect to climb the ladder unless you are planning to join the fraternal order.  Higher management females are often in nursing or marketing/sales and are hired for their appeal.  History of laying off staff who have health issues and take leave even though it is a healthcare organization.

review_title: DO NOT WORK FOR THIS CORRUPT COMPANY
pros: Besides the residents, who really are great, There are no pro’s. Once you actually get hired you soon realize how corrupt the company is.
cons: SEVERELY UNDER-STAFFED, management doesn’t appreciate any hard work done by staff. You’ll be hired as a security officer but your responsibilities will include 90% janitorial work( collecting all residents garbage in the ENTIRE FACILITY), going to resident rooms to clean carpets, asked to vacuum dining hall areas, mop kitchens, etc. You will spend less time doing any actual Security then it takes you to drive there. Since the termination of Executive Director Perry Phillips, the company has gone downhill fast. Please be aware that you will not be treated fairly if you work for Masonicare.

review_title: Excitement for 6 months then I was able  get better vision of nursing managers on units that started to crumble!!
pros: Getting to know the patients and family's, pay rate and health benefits great if you work weekend choice, communication with all staff through computers, and appreciation for the holidays worked.
cons: Teamwork, not enough staff, professionalism, patients aren't given enough personal care, too many short cuts in ALL departments, and no acknowledgement to worker's who go above and beyond to customer service!

review_title: Used to be a great place to work!
pros: The residents, compassionate co-workers, hourly rate
cons: Upper management doesn’t care about their employees. Quite often internal talent is bypassed. Culture is TOXIC and there is a lot of talk about improving it but there needs to be more than talk. Health benefits are terrible - HSA contributions have diminished over the years while premiums increase.

review_title: Masonicare is still the best place to work if you want to feel proud of the care you give your patients.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Wallingford, CT
pros: The facility is clean - not at all like a typical nursing home. Its more like a hospital and run that way too.  They have made some important changes in the past year in adminsitration and all for the better.  Many negative leaders are now gone.  The man in charge really listened to what the employees said they wanted.  There were complaints about certain people and now those people are gone!   staff are happy and patients are happy again.  all it takes is one bad apple to spoil teh bunch, and if its the apple in charge that drags the whole bunch down!  Overall the nursing management team at the Healthcare Center is very strong.  Staffing is good and the pay is good too.  Lots of people who have been there for a long time complain about the pay, but they stay so that must mean something.  Pay is high or fair compared to other similar companies.  Hospitals do pay more.    Tuition reimbursement and 401K with match is awesome.
cons: Every company has their sh*t, but i honestly think its less here than other places i have been.  I would still be at Masonicare now, but i needed to quit to focus on school.  You don't get much OT, but i think that speaks to the good staffing they have.    8 hr shifts vs 12 hrs shifts.  not necessarilly a con, but would be nice to see more 12 hr shift opportunities.

pros: The employees of Masonicare truly care for the residents and patients.  I have never seen such a positive work environment.  Leaving my previous job in "Corporate America" to come work for Masonicare was one of the best decisions I've ever made.
cons: Technology is lagging a little but they're working on improving things.

pros: Great company to work for! Masonicare treats their employees equally and with respect. Great teamwork and flexibility. Would definitely recommend the facility to others.
cons: As any company, there could be improvement to benefit the company. This includes solving simple mistakes that have happened in the past.

review_title: Working for independent company for Client residing in Rehabilitation Apartments.  WONDERDUL, friendly and helpful staff
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Wallingford, CT
pros: Independence, socialization, Full Time Nurses, Aides, etc. coverage if needed.  Residents are independent and feel and have better self esteem and clear thoughts, yet looked over if emergency.
cons: Big campus. Confusing to navigate!  The staff is so helpful though they will actually my drive you to building you need to be in.  Very helpful staff AND residents!

job_title: RN Case Manager in East Hartford, CT
pros: education, the patients, being on your own and setting your own schedule. being able to see patient progress for the better over the weeks with homecare. being  a part of a great interdisciplinary team
cons: driving alot. if patients are not available when you call. searching and finding patients if not home, medical benefits are bad high deductible plans and only match 401K 0.25 cents per dollar.  only give $500 in HSA yearly and you have to see doctor twice to get it its basically gone with those two doctor visits.

pros: The benefits the company offers are great.  As a whole, the company does show appreciation  for employees.  Beautiful campus.
cons: Sometimes it feels like your concerns aren't being heard by your direct management team.  In one ear and out the other.

pros: Great team, management alway there to help. Overall the company was a pleasure to work for. I would work for them again given the chance, I enjoyed my job. Masonicare cares about there employees. And that’s what made it a great place to work.
cons: That facility location was just to far. I worked at the one in Newtown and the distance everyday was a killer on my car. I wish they had a closer location. Then it would be perfect.

pros: Great location, Fantastic organization that does wonderful things for its patients.
cons: Senior Management is very dysfunctional.  They treat their employees very poorly and are defensive and abrasive with staff.  This is pervasive from the "C" suit through Human Res.

review_title: Exceptional company to work for and truly the best in customer care for their residents, highest standards in every area
pros: competitive wages, very friendly and warm atmosphere, stability in your position, room to advance, long lasting career positions, Compassionate and reassuring staff in all needs for the residents, a place where only the best for Mom will do
cons: Keeping calm during stressful emergencies

review_title: Phoney "Kindness Culture" took the CARE out of Masonicare
pros: Nice location, beautiful campus, many services and levels of care. Once was the best and a facility that I used to recommend.
cons: Masonicare until recently was a great place to work. Residents and employees were respected and the care was well coordinated. The nurses and CNA's treated the residents like family and worked as a team. The doctors and social workers were accessible and communicated with residents, families and the team. There were lots of meaningful and fun activities for residents. It is easy to care for residents and rehab patients who are satisfied and staff has time to stop and relate to them. There have been major changes in administration and they have introduced a phoney culture to replace the long standing Masonic atmosphere of collaboration and sincere respect. They have fired or harassed employees who have been there a long time into quitting. They have cut back coverage and hired young inexperienced staff. The response to other complaints has been to talk to HR. That must be a joke because HR is complicit in driving staff out and humiliating dedicated workers who really care about the residents. It is really tragic how the change in leadership and their callous regard for the staff and residents has destroyed a once well respected facility. The administration has a five year plan to build upscale retirement communities for private pay and are sacrificing the long term care services and rehab to reach their delusional goals.  The word is out in the community and Masonicare's reputation has been tarnished.

pros: The supervisors were extremely helpful and compassionate. They gave me time off when going through a family emergency.   The job was flexible , as I got to work the days I wanted.
cons: I worked there for 3 years, yet did not get much of a raise.  Only 85 cents. It was hard to get fulltime hours.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Wallingford, CT
pros: There are some nice people there
cons: They cheat you out your pto. I work there gave my two weeks notice . And they still manage to keep my pto. I called many times to see what happened they never return my call.

job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in East Hartford, CT
pros: flexibility. good pay grade. autonomy. learn a lot.computer driven. time management is a big deal.
cons: take home work is horrendous

pros: Great residents and co-workers.  O.K. pay.
cons: Management, most of Nursing, unfair distribution of work hours.

job_title: Home Care in East Hartford, CT
pros: The flexibility is great for working parents.   Able to make a difference in patients lives. Learn  a lot  about community resources
cons:
Poor communication.    Need to pay better 
Long hours more than the eight hours more like ten to twelve 
Unreasonable expectations

review_title: Employees and residents are great but...
pros:
Residents and most employees are great to work with
The HR lady at MHCC is top notch
cons: The work you do doesn't equal pay, upper management is terrible. The lack of respect they have for all employees is a disgrace. Benefits used to be aces at one point, internal servey last year prove that over 75 percent of employees were not happy

review_title: I felt like I was worthless
pros: good pay, some of the elderly people were nice
cons: My experience was horrible the job was very demanding and lacked any leadership or organization. Workers quit left and right I was hired for 10.5 hours but rarely actually worked that reaching up to 30 hours with no days off. I felt like a slave and at times wanted to quit asap.

review_title: Dont work here if your POC
pros: I had  a great manager once, who was invested in my growth in the company.
cons: Very segregated. especially in the Wallingford location. would not recommend if your POC.

review_title: Run turn around don’t even think about it
pros: None. None. None. None
cons: Pay is low cannot even pay my bills, healthcare insurance is expensive and you can’t even use it because of the High deductible. Management is talks down to you treats you like crap and does not want to hear your complaints. You are over worked and underpaid

job_title: Home Health Aide in Wallingford, CT
pros:
Good work-life balance. 
401k with employer match, even for per diem employees.
Competitive wages.
cons: High deductible benefit plan

review_title: Assisting residents with All Phases of daily labor in facility
pros: Nice place to work and retired but need more
cons: Need more hours and pay

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Norwalk, CT
pros: flexibility. collaborative approach. great hospice and home care clinical staff.
cons: travel long distance, /very corporate culture

review_title: Does not care about its employees
pros: Sorry. Can’t think of one.
cons: Basically fired its entire homecare rehab staff of OTs, PTs, and STs with no notice to a management company where we start with 0 seniority and interviewing for our jobs.

job_title: RN Case Manager in West Haven, CT
pros: Great coworkers. Great team players on the clinical level. Great patients.
cons: Upper management was a joke. Only cared about the numbers and the money, not about patient care. Employee concerns were brushed aside. Patients began to miss visits due to staffing issues.

pros: Large and Growing Non-Profit Organization
cons: Productivity/Does not feel like non-profit organization

pros: NONE AT ALL - REALLY
cons: YOU NAME IT. - DYSFUNCTIONAL MANAGEMENT MOSTLY

job_title: Customer Care Specialist in Wallingford, CT
pros: free parking and great residents
cons: poor leadership at the top
